xylaria mali.gloss: fungus causing black root rot in apples

xylaria polymorpha.gloss: the fruiting bodies of the fungi of the genus Xylaria

xylariaceae.gloss: family of fungi characterized by dark brown to black spores

xylene.gloss: a colorless flammable volatile liquid hydrocarbon used as a solvent

xylocaine.gloss: a local anesthetic (trade names Lidocaine and Xylocaine) used topically on the skin and mucous membranes

xylol.gloss: a colorless flammable volatile liquid hydrocarbon used as a solvent

xylomelum.gloss: small species of Australian trees or shrubs

xylomelum pyriforme.gloss: tree bearing pear-shaped fruit with a thick woody epicarp

xylophone.gloss: a percussion instrument with wooden bars tuned to produce a chromatic scale and with resonators

xylopia aethiopica.gloss: tropical west African evergreen tree bearing pungent aromatic seeds used as a condiment and in folk medicine

xylose.gloss: a sugar extracted from wood or straw

xylosma.gloss: shrub or small tree grown as an ornamental in mild climates for its neat evergreen foliage and fragrant late flowers

xylosma congestum.gloss: shrub or small tree grown as an ornamental in mild climates for its neat evergreen foliage and fragrant late flowers

xyphophorus helleri.gloss: freshwater fish of Central America having a long swordlike tail

xyridaceae.gloss: plants of tropical to temperate regions

xyris.gloss: chiefly American marsh plants, having usually yellow flowers
